speaker: Verso
line: Alicia?

speaker: Maelle
line: Actually, I prefer “Maelle.”

speaker: Verso
line: I think I do too. But I’m not really Verso, and you’re not really Maelle, are you?

speaker: Maelle
line: You’re not Verso, no. You look and sound just like him. But you’re you. I’m still Maelle though. You should’ve helped me remember.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. I… I wanted to— but I… I’m sorry.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m sorry too. If I’d listened to Maman— If I hadn’t trusted the Writers, Verso would still be alive, and you—

speaker: Verso
line: Wouldn’t exist.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wouldn’t be caught in the middle. Maman did a terrible thing, painting you into Verso’s Canvas. Giving you his memories. Pretending the fire only took me. But I’m glad you exist.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father was right to erase everyone. It’s better this way.

speaker: Maelle
line: Better for who? Verso would have never wanted his Canvas gone. He loved Esquie and his Gestrals and Grandis.

speaker: Verso
line: It was killing my… our mother, staying here so long in a make-believe world with her make-believe family.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s not make-believe. It’s not… You’re not… To me. Papa’s here. He’ll help me fix Lumière.

speaker: Verso
line: Will he?

speaker: Maelle
line: Maman painted a rather unflattering portrait of him. He’s much warmer than the Renoir you know.

speaker: Verso
line: I bet.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father was the one erasing everyone. Why would he help repaint everything?

speaker: Maelle
line: I hid the Canvas before I entered, so Maman can’t come back again. There’s no need to erase the Canvas anymore.

speaker: Verso
line: He’ll want you to go home.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not at risk like Maman. I haven’t been in this Canvas that long. Besides, Papa has a soft spot for me, he’ll listen.

speaker: Verso
line: Hmm.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa!

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia. You’re safe. I thought I told you to stay home.

speaker: Maelle
line: Technically my body’s at home.

speaker: Renoir
line: Some of Aline’s finest work. I regret that it caused you so much pain. What Aline did was unfair, to you most of all. Please, accept the Dessendre family’s apologies. I know it seems absurd to offer oblivion as recompense, but perhaps that’s the outcome we both desire.

speaker: Maelle
line: What—

speaker: Renoir
line: I’m proud of you. Getting your mother out of the Canvas was not easy. But once we erase the Canvas, we won’t have to worry anymore.

speaker: Maelle
line: But she’s home now, why—

speaker: Renoir
line: You know your mother. Verso painted this Canvas, it contains a piece of his soul. She’ll never willingly part with it.

speaker: Maelle
line: No.

speaker: Renoir
line: For the sake of the living, we must part with the dead.

speaker: Maelle
line: No, Papa, see, I hid the canvas—

speaker: Renoir
line: She will always find it. This is our only opportunity, while she’s too sick from her prolonged descent into the canvas to return.

speaker: Maelle
line: But— No… Papa, Papa, please. This is Verso’s only Canvas. You can’t destroy the last piece of him that we have. This is my home now! You can’t just decide—

speaker: Renoir
line: Your home? After all that with your mother, you want to stay?

speaker: Maelle
line: You know how little remains of my life. Outside.

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia. You’ll die. You’ve already been here longer than you should.

speaker: Maelle
line: But—

speaker: Renoir
line: No. Look at me, I said no. I am not letting my daughter risk her life. Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not Maman. I’m not going to lose myself if I stay!

speaker: Renoir
line: I know full well you will. And I am not doing this again.

speaker: Maelle
line: No! Papa, what are you—

speaker: Renoir
line: It’s time to go home.

speaker: Esquie
line: Mes amis!

speaker: Monoco
line: All aboard!

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso, come on. Come on! I can see them.
